required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intratumoral Bromelain + Acetylcysteine in Relapsed and Unresectable Pseudomyxoma Peritonei
clinical_study.official_title: Intratumoral Bromelain + N-acetylcysteine in Relapsed and Unresectable Pseudomyxoma Peritonei. Phase I Single-arm Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

clinical_study.source: Maimónides Biomedical Research Institute of Córdoba

brief_summary.textblock: This trial pursues studying a compassionate treatment option for patients with inoperable pseudomyxoma peritonei through percutaneous administration of bromelain + N-acetylcysteine (NAC) in order to decrease tumoral volume. Secondary endpoints are the decrease of ascites, compressive symptoms and pain through the dilution of mucins, which would better intestinal blockage.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 3, Day 7 (if it applies),1 month and 12 months after treatment is finished.
primary_outcome.description: Tumoral mass change calculated through CT Scan or Magnetic Resonance categorized regarding the biggest diameter per abdominal region

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Basal visit, 1 month and 12 months after treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Symptoms progression evaluated through QLQ-C30 questionnaire (life quality questionnaire)
Period of time free of tumor progression.
Time until death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Tumoral DNA diminution in biological samples
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Basal visit, all treatment visits and 12 months after treatment is finished.
secondary_outcome.description: Diminution of tumoral DNA amount found in mucin and blood samples

arm_group.description: Patients with pseudomyxoma peritonei that are not candidates to surgical resection

intervention.description: 0.5mg per mL of total tumor volume calculated, administered percutaneously
20mg per mL of total tumor volume calculated, administered percutaneously

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Pseudomyxoma peritonei diagnosis through imaging tests and/or histological studies
- Pseudomyxoma peritonei relapse in abdominal area in patients who comply inoperability criteria, which are:
At least two HIPEC operations or major abdominal surgery (PSS > 3). Patients with acute morbidities (ASA score IV)
- ECOG 0-2
- Age ≥ 18
- Signs informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Candidates to other potentially healing treatments
- Allergy to bromelains (pineapple), N-Acetylcysteine or possible cross-reactive allergy (eggs, sulphate. latex, carrots, celery, wheat...)
- Non-manageable coagulation alterations
- No possibility of intraabdominal drainage catheter
- Acute respiratory pathology (asthma, COPD), acute hepatic, cardiopathic or kidney pathology
- Allergy to any substance that might cause crossed reactivity to bromelain
- Unwillingness to participate in this clinical trial

patient_data.ipd_description: Data will be shared after the study concludes and results are published
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Upon request to study's principal investigator
